text:
Hi there! I am trying to identify the workflow that was responsible for setting a property's value. More specifically:
I am pulling contacts from the API with property history by setting `propertyMode=value_and_history`. On each historic value for a contact property a `source_id` is provided. Whenever a workflow has set the value for the property it would say something like: `enrollmentId:62418357786;actionExecutionIndex:2`.
Now, I need to know which workflow this is. However, the `enrollmentId` is _not_ the workflow ID. So, how do I now retrieve the workflow that was responsible for setting this value? I assume this must be possible somehow, as the HubSpot UI actually shows a linked name of the workflow responsible for the update.
Thanks for your help :pray:

If you can find the data you need in Developer Info json, you can send append it to a hidden field in a form. To view Developer Info open the Sprocket Menu (right top), when your browsing your HubSpot site (and logged in), and click Developer Info
Why donâ€™t you pull all contacts through the api and then filter the results in your code?
Or have you tried using the `HAS_PROPERTY` operator?

Hi,

I am Alex from Enveseur IT department, we are looking for a partner or developer to help us for make an API to connect OrderWise API (<https://orderwise.co.uk/>) and HubSpot API for import all our companies, contacts and products from OrderWise to HubSpot. If somebody is interested contact me on <mailto:alex@enveseur.es|alex@enveseur.es> for speak the details and declare a budget. Thank you so much.
Thanks <@UCBDLK6SU>! It looks like it has what I need, but how do I access it via code?
So if you have a specific `thing` in the JSON, you can simply `{{ thing }}` in HubL and it will output the value of it.
Awesome! That was a really big help - thanks again <@UCBDLK6SU>!!
